text: Luigi Andreoni or Luis Andreoni (Vercelli, Italy, October 7, 1853 – Montevideo, May 20, 1936) was an Italian engineer and architect of outstanding performance in Uruguay. ==Biography== Educated in Turin, he graduated in 1875 and arrived in Montevideo in 1876. He was a distinguished representative of historical eclecticism in Montevideo. Looking to Europe as a model, Andreoni enriched the city with the seal of the belle époque. Of note are Ospedale Italiano Umberto I (1884-1890), Club Uruguay (1888), Buxareo Palace (about 1890) (current French Embassy), Theatre Stella d'Italia (1895) (now Teatro La Gaviota) and General Artigas Central Railway Station, opened in 1897. He also had a collection of classical archeology, currently preserved in the Palace Taranco. ==Literature== * * ==References== Category:1853 births Category:1936 deaths Category:19th-century Italian architects Category:20th-century Italian architects Category:Uruguayan architects Category:Italian engineers Category:Italian expatriates in Uruguay Category:People from Vercelli Category:People from Montevideo
